client

Class DFSOutputStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.OutputStream
      • client.DFSOutputStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, Flushable, AutoCloseable

    public class DFSOutputStream
extends OutputStream
    Output stream directed to a file in the distributed filesystem.

    Write calls on a DFSOutputStream are directed to a storage server hosting the given file. Each call corresponds to one network request. If this is not desirable, the DFSOutputStream should be wrapped in a BufferedOutputStream object.

    Creating a DFSOutputStream for a file does not cause the file to be created or truncated. The file must exist, and the existing file data is left in place. Writes to the stream cause file data to be overwritten, starting from the beginning of the file.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DFSOutputStream

        public DFSOutputStream(Service naming_server,
               Path file)
                throws FileNotFoundException,
                       IOException
        Creates a DFSOutputStream for a file listed by the given naming server.

        The file should be locked on the naming server for exclusive access.

        Parameters:
        naming_server - Stub for the naming server hosting metadata for the file.
        file - Path to the file.
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - If the file is not listed by the given naming server, or if the path refers to a directory.
        IOException - If either the naming server or the storage server hosting the file cannot be contacted to retrieve file metadata.

      • DFSOutputStream

        public DFSOutputStream(String hostname,
               Path file)
                throws FileNotFoundException,
                       IOException
        Creates a DFSOutputStream for a file listed by the given naming server.

        The file should be locked on the naming server for exclusive access. The naming server is contacted on the default client interface port.

        Parameters:
        hostname - Address of the naming server hosting metadata for the file.
        file - Path to the file.
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - If the file is not listed by the given naming server, or if the path refers to a directory.
        IOException - If either the naming server or the storage server hosting the file cannot be contacted to retrieve file metadata.

      • DFSOutputStream

        public DFSOutputStream(Service naming_server,
               String filename)
                throws FileNotFoundException,
                       IOException
        Creates a DFSOutputStream for a file listed by the given naming server.

        The file should be locked on the naming server for exclusive access.

        Parameters:
        naming_server - Stub for the naming server hosting metadata for the file.
        filename - Path to the file, as a string.
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - If the file is not listed by the given naming server, or if the path refers to a directory.
        IOException - If either the naming server or the storage server hosting the file cannot be contacted to retrieve file metadata.

               String filename)

        Creates a DFSOutputStream for a file listed by the given naming server.

    • Method Detail

      • close

        public void close()
           throws IOException
        Closes the output stream.

        The stream is marked as closed. Further attempts to use the output stream will result in IOException.

        Specified by:
        close in interface Closeable
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
        Overrides:
        close in class OutputStream
        Throws:
        IOException

      • write

        public void write(byte[] buffer,
         int buffer_offset,
         int write_length)
           throws IOException
        Writes bytes from a buffer to the output stream.

        The write is performed in a single request to the storage server.

        Overrides:
        write in class OutputStream
        Parameters:
        buffer - Buffer containing bytes to be written.
        buffer_offset - Offset into the buffer from which bytes are to be written.
        write_length - Number of bytes to be written.
        Throws:
        IOException - If the stream is closed, if the storage server cannot be contacted, or if a write error occurs on the storage server.
        NullPointerException - If buffer is null.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - If buffer_offset or write_length is negative, or if buffer_offset + write_length exceeds the length of the given buffer.

      • write

        public void write(int b)
           throws IOException
        Writes a single byte to the output stream.
        Specified by:
        write in class OutputStream
        Parameters:
        b - Value of the byte to be written. The argument is taken modulo 256 to obtain the byte value.
        Throws:
        IOException - If the stream is closed, if the storage server cannot be contacted, or if a write error occurs on the storage server.

      • skip

        public void skip(long count)
          throws IOException
        Advances the stream offset.

        It is possible to advance the offset past the current end of file.

        Parameters:
        count - Number of bytes to advance stream offset by.
        Throws:
        IOException - If the stream has been closed.
